logicalComponents
Class Joint

java.lang.Object
  logicalComponents.Joint

public class Joint
extends java.lang.Object

Logically represents a single hinged joint with a fixed range of motion. The position of the joint is monitored in relation to a maximum and minimum value, and its position is reported as a value between 0 and Joint.MAX_VALUE.

The maximum value need not be greater than the minimum value in order to record accurate values for the position of a joint. The position of a joint is interpreted to be the percentage of the range from the minimum value to the position in comparison to the total fixed range of motion of the joint. This percentage is then multiplied by the maximim value to represent a point in a fixed range regardless of the limitation of the actual maximum and minimum values.

Author:
Daniel McDonald

Constructor Summary
Joint()
          Creates an instance of the Joint class with default minimum and maximum values of 0 and Joint.MAX_VALUE, respectively.

          Creates an instance of the Joint class with specified minimum and maximum values of minimum and maximum, respectively.
 
Method Summary
 int getMax()
          Returns the maximum value of this Joint's range of motion, which is not necessarily a value that is less than the maximum value.

public Joint()
Creates an instance of the Joint class with default minimum and maximum values of 0 and Joint.MAX_VALUE, respectively.

See Also:
Joint.MAX_VALUE

Joint

public Joint(int minimum,
             int maximum)
Creates an instance of the Joint class with specified minimum and maximum values of minimum and maximum, respectively.

Parameters:
minimum - The minimum value of this Joint's range of motion.
maximum - The maximum value of this Joint's range of motion.
Method Detail

setPosition

public void setPosition(int pos)
Sets the position of this Joint to the specified value, if the argument is within the range of the Joint's minimum and maximum values.

Parameters:
pos - The position of the Joint

setMax

public void setMax(int pos)
Sets the maximum range of motion value for this Joint. If the max position is the same as the min position, then the min position is decremented by 1 so as to prevent the joint from appearing fixed. This property has no use for this project.

Parameters:
pos - The new maximum position for this Joint's range of motion.

setMin

public void setMin(int pos)
Sets the minimum range of motion value for this Joint. If the max position is the same as the min position, then the max position is incremented by 1 so as to prevent the joint from appearing fixed. This property has no use for this project.

Parameters:
pos - The new minimum position for this Joint's range of motion.

getPosition

public double getPosition()
Returns the position of this Joint in relation to Joint.MAX_VALUE. It determines the percentage of the "bendedness" of the Joint and then reflects that percentage in terms of the range from 0 to 1.

Returns:
The position of the Joint, between 0 and 1.
See Also:
Joint.MAX_VALUE

getMax

public int getMax()
Returns the maximum value of this Joint's range of motion, which is not necessarily a value that is less than the maximum value.

Returns:
The maximum value of this Joint's range of motion.

getMin

public int getMin()
Returns the minimum value of this Joint's range of motion, which is not necessarily a value that is less than the maximum value.

Returns:
The minimum value of this Joint's range of motion.
